forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 54. South southwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind 12 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, a heavy drape of clouds blankets the city, hinting at the rain that will soon begin to fall. The night air is thick and restless, a south-southwest breeze sweeping through at a brisk pace, whispering secrets of the ocean. The forecast promises a steady downpour, with the city’s iconic hints of light glimmering against the gloom, offering a momentary glow amidst the heavy drizzle expected tonight.

Emerging into Monday, the city will be enveloped in the same damp embrace, as temperatures hover in the low fifties, inviting a sense of coziness inside. With the morning fog possibly swirling off the Bay and a relentless rain forecasted, the marine layer will be more than just a backdrop; it will be a character, shifting and shaping the day in a peculiar dance of dampness and shadow. As one contemplates their attire, a sturdy raincoat and resilient footwear become essential companions. Those braving the elements might find pleasure in the simple act of sipping a warm coffee in a favorite café or exploring the intimate corners of local bookstores, where the world outside blurs into a canvas of rain-soaked stories waiting to be discovered.
